fields.description: We have issue types like Task and Requirement. If I make subtask of a Task and a subtask of a Requirement, all subtasks have the same type code -3. So it is not possible to search subtasks by its type.
fields.summary: Subtasks of an issue should have the same type like its parent issue

fields.description:
In some case Jira returns next rss xml 

<item>
...
<key id="11823">(projectName-1152)</key> 
...
</item>

instead of 

<item>
...
<key id="11823">projectName-1152</key> 
...
</item>

I use third party clients to connect to Jira and it use rss to parse project name, as you can see Jira returns value of the "key" with brackets, but third party clients
doesn't expects one while parsing.
fields.summary: Incorrect project name in rss response

fields.description:
Get all the editable fields in the edit issue screen, however it does not included "Reporter" field, "DueDate" field" and "FixVersion" field:

{noformat}
ID:summary, Name:Summary
ID:issuetype, Name:Issue Type
ID:priority, Name:Priority
ID:components, Name:Component/s
ID:versions, Name:Affects Version/s
ID:environment, Name:Environment
ID:description, Name:Description
ID:timetracking, Name:Time Tracking
ID:customfield_10000, Name:Multi User Picker
ID:customfield_10010, Name:User Picker
{noformat}
fields.summary: getFieldsForEdit does not included "Reporter" field, "Due Date" field and "FixVersion" field

fields.description:
If you have Jelly text containing a variable reference, eg:

<jira:CreateIssue summary="Incorrectly set ${JAVA_HOME} variable" .../>

JIRA's jelly runner silently replaces "${JAVA_HOME}" with "", effectively corrupting your data.

The 'solution' for this is for users to convert all ${...}'s to $${...} in the Jelly script text. However since nobody knows about this, and it's painful to do, I think we should modify the code to only replace variables that have a value.
fields.summary: Jelly runner silently deletes all undefined ${variable} references

fields.description: When you delete a project role any comments/worklogs that have that visibility restriction will no longer be seen. The delete group page allows you to specify a "swap group" which will change all the visibility restrictions to the new group. The project role delete needs this functionality.
fields.summary: Delete project role does not allow you to specify a swap role like the delete group does

fields.description:
Customer for case [CSP-12210|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-12210|] has discovered when adding a comment which contains long continuous lines, will cause the window to stretch extremely long. 

I will attach a comment as an example.
fields.summary: Comments with long lines will causes window to stretch to exteremly long width

fields.description:
The delete group page will prompt you for a swap group if there are any comment visibility restricted by that group. This used to work for worklogs as well when they were stored in the same table as the comments. When they were moved out this stopped working.

The behavior that will be seen is that if you delete a group you will just never see the worklog again, it will be an orphan. The delete group needs to be fixed to include a check against worklogs as well as comments.
fields.summary: Deleting a group does not check if there are any worklogs with the group restriction like it does for comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13698].
  {panel}

I get the following error when I try to recieve a response that should be formatted as a RemoteWorklog:

System.InvalidCastException was caught
  Message="Unable to cast object of type 'System.Xml.XmlNode[]' to type 'StarNet.Jira.Library.Jira.RemoteWorklog'."
  Source="StarNet.Jira.Library"
  StackTrace:
       at StarNet.Jira.Library.Jira.JiraSoapServiceService.addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimate(String in0, String in1, RemoteWorklog in2)
       at StarNet.Jira.Library.Service.AddWorkLogToIssue(String issueKey, RemoteWorklog workLog)

After closer analysis the main issue here is that the SOAP response has the following definition for the Worklog namespace:
xsi:type="ns3:IssueServiceImpl$RemoteWorklogImpl"
But in .Net the '$' character is not valid in xsi type descriptions.

To get around this I have re-written the RPC for our live server to return a Long value as the RemoteWorklog.id.
This is generally more practiacl anyway, though I would really like to get the whole object for the sake continuity as I cannot be sure how the Service will modify the Worklog after updates.

I have attached the diff file for anyone interested in similar functionality. (there are a few other features in this diff file for your pleasure also!)
*Please Note that these changes will break the standard test scripts.

further structural issues:
RemoteWorklog object has readonly properties, this doesn't directly affect how the object is comsumed at the client end but with a severe lack of documentation it is impossible to know which fields are expected to be changed when the object is passed as a parameter to the Soap Service.
fields.summary: RemoteWorklog doesn not deserialize in .Net

fields.description:
Currently a Report plugin can list a set of options that the user will use to configure the report they want. This list is then put into a map - currently a HashMap and then returned to the UI to iterate over and display to the user. Thus the order in which they are displayed in subject to the hash function of the key to each option - rather than the listed order in the {{*plugin.xml}} file.

This change needs to be made in {{configurable-objects}}
fields.summary: Order of Report Options is non-deterministic

fields.description: The 'Importing from Other Systems' section should have an overview so that it is possible to pass a URL to users interested in the import options for JIRAImporting from Other Systems.
fields.summary: Add overview of importing data from other systems

fields.description:
The current documentation for migrating from database to another at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/databases/switchingdbs.html is incomplete.

- Step 1 should explain what data is included in an XML backup
- "Alter your JIRA instance to use the new database, following the database-specific steps described in the previous section." should be rephrased and linked to http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/databases/index.html
- Step 3 should explain why the 'setup page' is shown and to use the original paths when requests
- Add detail on stopping and starting the server eg live users
- Review to see if theres anything else missing
fields.summary: Add missing setup information to guide on switching databases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13694].
  {panel}

The current RSS support limits the fields that you can export.  It is after all only intended to provide users with an RSS view of the issues.  However, it would be useful if the existing XML link would allow you to get a comprehensive dump of the currently visible issues in XML, and select an XSLT transform to be applied to the XML.  The use case would be something like this:

(1) User opens the issue navigator, performs appropriate filtering, then clicks the XML link.
(2) Popup appears allowing the user to select from one of the registered XSLTs. 
(3) The selected transform is then applied to XML.

The default XSLTs might include GanttProject, and MS Project XML file formats.

Making it pluggable makes it possible for administrators to add their own XSLTs to support additional export formats.  These might include transforms that take JIRA issues and generate requirements documentation in XHTML or other formats.
fields.summary: Allow Pluggable XSLT support in XML Export

fields.description:
JRA-12360 corrected JIRA so that it can still display an issue even if it references a user that is not longer in the crowd database. However, bad things happen if you attempt to edit the issue, either singly or in bulk, and it prevents you from correcting the missing user problem.
I'm attaching a couple of stack traces:

1. What happens when you try to edit an issue assigned to or reported by a non-existent user.
2. What happend after the user is recreated in Crowd.

We should also test if anything bad happens with comments by non-existant users.
fields.summary: Missing user does bad things on issue update

fields.description:
When I Close/Resolve/Assign/Link/Etc. issue would be good to see issue subject.
If I switch to other window (email, document, program) and then switch back to JIRA quite often I cannot recall what's the issue it was.
Have to close the screen to read subject and then click Action again.

Screens Link, Assign, etc. have plenty of available screen place for the Subject to show.
fields.summary: Show "Subject" of issues on Action/Operation pages

fields.description:
This was annoying. We have lots of projects and filters set up with multiple projects included.

When we deleted a project we expected to have that dropped from the filters that had included it, instead they have all reverted to the All projects category.
fields.summary: Saved filters reverted to "All projects" when we deleted a project contained
Import from trac

fields.description:
The translation for "Unresolved" and "Resolution" is incorrect in the French locale.
"Non Traite" in French does not mean "unresolved" and it conveys the wrong idea that it has not been dealt with at all. it should be "non resolu".
Same with "Traitement" which does not apply to issues but people! (A bit like medical treatment)....It should be "Resolution"...
fields.summary: French Translation Incorrect "traitement"
Cannot use unclosed variable text "${" in Jelly scripts

fields.description:
JIRA should better handle errors return from Crowd. For example, if Crowd doesn't allow user to reuse they old password and user will try to do so, JIRA doesn't display any notification, but the error:
{noformat}
 Cause:
com.opensymphony.user.ImmutableException

Stack Trace: [hide]

com.opensymphony.user.ImmutableException
at com.opensymphony.user.User.setPassword(User.java:106)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.user.ChangePassword.doExecute(ChangePassword.java:36)
at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:54)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:209)
{noformat}
and in the log file is recoded:
{noformat}
2007-10-03 13:47:54,999 http-8443-Processor19 ERROR [crowd.integration.osuser.CrowdCredentialsProvider] Password already has been used.
com.atlassian.crowd.integration.exception.InvalidCredentialException: Password already has been used.
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
{noformat}

It would be nice, if JIRA would return something more meaningful to the end-users.
fields.summary: JIRA should better handle errors return from Crowd (notificaton messages)

fields.description:
The issue navigator hides every column being not part of every selected issue type. This behaviour is to restrictive because this makes it very complicated to display a mix of different issue types with all important information (columns). When I select to display a custom field X and the search criteria is more general and includes also issue types which haven't the custom field X this column isn't displayed. This behaviour makes it necessary to create much more filters as normally needed and as result we are unable to create one view with all needed information.

I guess it is very easy to show also columns (when selected for view) which are not part of every issue type - in the affected case as empty cells.
fields.summary: Don't hide columns in the issue navigator

fields.description: When importing a CSV file and creating a new project, JIRA allows using numbers in the Project Key field. The project gets created successfully and the import works fine, but no issue details can be viewed or edited after import.
fields.summary: Importing CSV File Allows Numbers in Project Key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13681].
  {panel}

I would like the project select list to always default to NO value at the creation of issue. I want that the user choose systematiccally the project for which he want to create an issue.

In my case, at the 1st connexion to JIRA in the morning, the default project select in the list, for an issue creation,  is the 1st one in the list occured a lot of problem. This first project receives a lot of issues not for him.

Thank to implement this issue as soon as possible. I know how many issues you have, and how many are very urgent, but this one is very urgent for us.
Cheers
fields.summary: Allow to have no project selected by default during create an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13680].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA does not support a "Lead" status within a Group. This is weird because when an issue gets to a certain state, it often has to be auto-assigned the The Guy In Charge first who will decide what to do next. (E.g. if an issue gets to "To Be Regressed", it should be assigned to QA Lead first (automatically), and then reassigned by the lead to a particular resource.)

What would be nice to have from this standpoint is: 

- Capability to define a "Default Member" / "Lead" of a Group 
- A post-function to auto-assign issue to a Lead of specified Group (selected from a dropdown list) 

The "Assign to Group" plugin does not qualify because it requires explicitly specifying the Group Lead in transition properties which's a maintenance problem. Defining users and groups must be located entirely in User Management section, else evey time a group lead is hired/fired, the admin would have to swicth workflows (which may take up to hours if the databse is big enough) and modify every certain transition to change the user defined there.
fields.summary: Enable auto-assigning to Group Lead

fields.description: The property field of JIRA's portlets and reports are not  in order sequence which is following in the {{atlassian-plugin.xml}}. For further details, please refer to the sample screenshots:
fields.summary: The property field for JIRA's portlets and reports are not  in order sequence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13676].
  {panel}

The subscriptions functionality is great, but it's really hard to get a handle on what subscriptions I currently have.

The list of filters in the 'Manage' screen of the Issue Navigator gets to be enormous once a few shared filters are there, and it's difficult to scroll through and find the ones I'm subscribed to.

It would be great to either:

- have a list of subscribed filters separate to 'Viewable filters' on the 'Manage' screen of the Issue Navigator
- have a list of subscriptions under my profile.

Implementing both would be super.
fields.summary: Screen which shows summary of subscriptions

fields.description:
How do I get emails every 3 hours? See the attached screenshot for one way that doesn't work.

Several problems:

- I entered a valid cron expression for this subscription ("0 0 0/3 * * ?") but saving resulted in a subscription that said "Every 15 minutes from -1 to -1".
- Trying to change it brings me to the GUI editor ("daily") instead of the cron expression editor ("advanced"), where I wasn't able to select a subscription for every 3 hours over the entire day.

Other minor quirks:

- Even though the label says "daily" there's an interval field which includes options that aren't daily. This is confusing. The label should be "regularly" or "frequently" or something like that.
- There's no way to pick the start and end time such that the entire day is covered. Picking 12am to 12am gives an error. This is the standard way of indicating an entire day and should be supported.
- The drop-down list for hours puts 1 at the top, when really 12 should be at the top. (12 am comes before 1 am.)
fields.summary: Daily filter subscription editor converts "every 3 hours" cron expression into an invalid "daily interval" subscription

fields.description: When {{newBuildWithOldLicenseExpiryDate}} is shown, the {{outlookdate}} was misspelled and would display a null date.
fields.summary: Admin portlet can show null date for license expirery

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13672].
  {panel}

Currently the default using of "Porter" stemming means that certain search phrases do not return results that the user might expect.

For example if the issue summary is "Moose problems" then the default stemming will cause "moos" to be stored in the index.

If the user then enters a search request for "Moose" then no match will be made.  The reason is that the Lucene QueryParser code does NOT perform analysis on "Prefix" queries by default.

Hence a PrefixQuery for the term "moose" is submitted and the index doent contain this terms and hence no issue is returned.

The improvement would be to tweak QueryParser so that it does perform "analysis" on prefix queries.  So the term "moose" would be stemmed to "moos" and then the Prefix Query would return the expected results.
fields.summary: Better searching when stemming is in place.  Improve  Lucene QueryParser to perform analysis on prefixed queries.

fields.description: It would be really nice if you could set up fields on a sub-task to autopopulate when you create the subtask from the parent issue.  For instance, I have a user story issue type.  When we create the subtasks required to do the work in an interation, I have manually select the fix version for every subtask of teh parent story.  It would be really nice if by default it set the fix version to the fixversion from the parent issue (the user story).  The user could then change it if needed but it would be great to have that pre-filled by default.
fields.summary: Would like to have certain feilds prepopulated on subtasks from the parent issue

fields.description: It would be VERY helpful to have the ability to mark fields as required on a per screen basis.  I know about the plugin that makes things required on transition but that doesn't solve all issues.  I want to be able to make certain fields required when you add some issue types but not ALL issue types.
fields.summary: Would like to be able to mark certain fields required on SOME screens, not all screens
Make field required per issue status

fields.description: Please see the screenshot attached.. more
fields.summary: Missing i18n keys in notification scheme
Unable to search for Greek language symbol "Σ" after it has converted to (ς) or (σ)
PermissionsParameter should optimize the way it builds the Issue Security Level permission checks

fields.description:
The documentation page at http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/rpc-jira-plugin/latest/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/JiraSoapService.html is probably generated from code. However, some of the function calls (mostly towards the very top and very bottom of the list) contains a short summary of what the function call does at a high level. However, in the middle, this summary seems to be missing. For example, "getFieldsForAction" has no summary information at all. There is no hint of WHY I might want to use this function call.

Please go through the function calls on this page and update the summaries to the level of, for example, all the "WorkLog" related function calls at the bottom.
fields.summary: Better documentation for the JIRA Soap Service

fields.description:
Using the Auto Transition Listener, one can run an existing transition. In my case the transition I wanted to use had the "summary" field on it. When the Auto Transition Listener runs, it sets the "summary" field to null.

I have noticed in the APIs that run transitions, those APIs state that any field not specifically set in the transition are set to null. However there are function calls (getFieldsForAction, for example) that help this design decision.

I would like to see the Auto Transition Listener to use some function like this so that I don't have to have a special transition for the Auto Transition Listener.
fields.summary: Improve Auto Transition Listener so that fields are not nulled out

fields.description:
We are running the CVS Integration with a number of CVS Modules.

The problem we have is that from time to time the CVS update fails for a given module for various reasons and then it remains in a locked state with the lock file ???.log.write.lock.

The issue is that until someone cleans up the file manually,  that CVS log file never gets update and we then get a message that the file is being parsed.

Is there anything that can be done to automatically clean up the file (i.e. if the file is more than 1 day old then delete it and restart??).
fields.summary: CVS Update fails and leaves the Lock file indefinetly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13659].
  {panel}

When an issue is moved between projects, the original issue key is left unassigned, it is never reused, and exists solely as a searchable item pointing to the new issue key. 
If the issue is subsequently moved back to the original project it is then assigned a new issue key in the project. 
It would make more sense if the original issue key was reassigned to the issue.
* Recently we needed to 'undo' an incorrect move, and users subsequently queried why the number had changed.
fields.summary: Moving an issue back to a previous project SHOULD re-use the 'old' issue key

fields.description:
On the view screen, with time tracking on and sub tasks, you see the "Time Tracking" section with "Issue & Sub-Tasks" selected. To switch to the other view you have a link "Issue". When you first see this it's not all that clear what this is view is going to show. (It shows the time tracking info for this issue only)

Some thoughts:

* Consider "Issue Only" rather than "Issue"
* Have a longer descriptive title attribute (for tooltip) for both links (when they are links)
fields.summary: Time Tracking Label for "Issue"

fields.description: The AttachFile tag currently does not have the 'created' attribute. This attribute would be very useful when importing data into JIRA.
fields.summary: Allow AttachFile jelly tag to specify the created date for an attachment

fields.description:
When trying to add an attachment to a closed issue an error screen is displayed as per attachment.
It contains the :
- error message
- gui to select/browse file
- comment field

I believe that only the error message should be display notifying that this operation is not permitted for the user
{quote}

Errors

    * You can not create attachments as the issue is in a non-editable workflow state.
{quote}
fields.summary: Inconsistent UI for adding attachments when the AttachFile default.jspa

fields.summary: DataAccessException when performing assignee related issue operations with non-existent assignee

fields.description:
Hello,

It would be very usefull to support secondary email for users.
Sometimes, people send the email to the support with a different email address and it is ignored without warning (because the user is not recognized and anonymous has no right to create ticket in this project.
At least, having a bounce message explaining the mail has been rejected would be helpfull.
fields.summary: several emails per user

fields.description:
Integration JIRA with Apache with 'blank' context path. User proposed that this appears to work in httpd.conf. For example:

{noformat}
<Proxy *>
Order deny,allow
Allow from all
</Proxy>

SSLProxyEngine on
ProxyRequests Off
ProxyPreserveHost On

<Location />
ProxyPass https://jira.mycompany.com:8443/
ProxyPassReverse https://jira.mycompany.com:8443/
</Location>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Improve Integrating JIRA with Apache documentation

fields.description:
I am on a windows box with JIRA Evaluation license. When I run a very very simply jelly script configured via the JellyService, I ALWAYS ALWAYS get the following error in the output file:

Configuration
------------------
input file: C:\devjellyscript.jelly
output file: C:\devjellyscript-output.jelly

Error
-------
null:-1:-1: <null> Could not parse Jelly script

Contents of devjellyscript.jelly:
-----------------------------------------
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib" xmlns:core="jelly:core" xmlns:log="jelly:log" xmlns:xml="jelly:xml">
<jira:Login username="sandeep" password="sandeep">
	<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TEST" summary="Shared Component Libraries" reporter="sjangity" created="2007-04-18 09:55:12" assignee="developer" duplicateSummary="ignore" components="other" environment="All" updated="2007-07-12 14:19:55" issueKeyVar="issuekey101627" issueType="Improvement" priority="Critical" description="test"/>
</JiraJelly>

This is a SHOWSTOPPER for us as we evaluate JIRA.
fields.summary: can't run jelly script as a service, period

fields.description:
The <jira:AttachFile> Jelly tag requires that the 'key' attribute point to an existing JIRA Issue, which doesn't make much sense when we do this through a jelly script which has none of that information for a dynamic generated issue.

This works fine:
<jira:AttachFile key="TEST-1939" filepath="c:\SharedComponentLibraries.JPG" option="add"/>


But this doesn't:
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TEST" assignee="-1" summary="Issue summary 111" reporter="sandeep" issueKeyVar="issuekey1"/>
<jira:AttachFile key="${issuekey1}" filepath="C:\SharedComponentLibraries.jpg" option="override"/>

This tag appears broken.

Thanks,
Sandeep
fields.summary: can't attach files to Issues

fields.description:
Here's my namespace declaration for my jelly script:
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib" xmlns:core="jelly:core" xmlns:log="jelly:log" xmlns:xml="jelly:xml">

but even when i do something so simple as:
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib" xmlns:core="jelly:core" xmlns:xml="jelly:xml">
   <xml:if test="${var}=='sean'}/>
</JiraJelly>

JellyRunner throws this exception:
Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: xml
java.io.PrintWriter@3bd05b

I can't emit any xml content in my jelly scripts which is a sure SHOWSTOPPER for us for migrating bugs into JIRA.

Please help or if possible suggest a possible workaround.

Thanks,
Sandeep
fields.summary: ClassNotFoundException when inputting simple xml/xsl tags in a jelly script - feature not supported?

fields.description:
When you issue the <jira:CreateIssue> in a jelly script, you have no access to the issue id that was generated. I need this information because <AttachFile> only accepts actual references to JIRA bugs (ie. name like OMNIO-1500 or something), but this information is not available at issue creation time as we only have issueKeyVar references found in the <jira:CreateIssue> tag. We CAN'T migrate to JIRA if this feature is not possible and we have several 100's of projects which will need for us to leverage this capability to attach files amongst other things.

I hope I was able to explain clearly. Any chance you guys can give this information to community members? This is a common request as I saw on the forums.

Thanks!

/Sandeep
fields.summary: unable to retrieve issue id for dynamic generated Issues in JIRA, absolutely critical for migration of bugs into JIRA

fields.description: When creating a new search quite often you have to scroll to find those fields you need for your search. Our users would like to be able to reduce the number of fields available for a search and/or to change the order of them.
fields.summary: Find issues: make order of search criteria configurable
display issue summary on "Close Issue" page

fields.description:
I am dynamically generating a jelly script, but I would like to be able to search for issues that match a particular summary.

The jelly tag: <jira:RunSearchRequest> only supports filtering with pre-defined searches. But there's no way to get issues for instance with summary field = "Testing summary" or something to that effect. Is this exposed through some hook that the <jelly:core> tags can invoke?

This is absolutely critical for us because when we are migrating into JIRA and we need to be able to move all this dynamic data from within the jelly script itself. Predefined searches is better for reporting, not for issue updating.

Please let me know if this is not possible or possible. I would appreciate it.
fields.summary: unable to specify search parameters via jelly script
An exception isn't thrown while editing duedate without permissions

fields.description:
I appreciate that you are improving a lot the time tracking features and reports but most of all our JIRA projekts are internal projects WITH customer access. Hence, we really have to hide the internal project tim tracking information (reports and issue detail view) from our customers. This is the reason why we can't enable this feature in JIRA globally. 

*If we would be able to control the visibility of the time tracking information by +permission scheme+ this would solve all our problems.*
fields.summary: Make visibility of time tracking information dependent on an user-right

fields.description:
This whole problem applies only when Hungarian locale is set in jira. When entering the search issue page the date from and date to fields are filled with this formatting:

12/szept./07

However if I change either date using the mini calendar, the format changes to:

11/sze/07

which is not an accepted format.

Please consider improving the calendar component to handle internationalization properly.
fields.summary: Calendar date picker can't be used with Hungarian locale

fields.description:
"issue not found" page has http 200  status (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JIRA-99999)
"project not found" page has http 404 status (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ASDF)

I think, there must be some common status for these pages, perhaps HTTP200.
fields.summary: Different HTTP status on "issue not found" and "project not found" pages

fields.description:
Hello,

Refercing the following jelly script:
----------------------------------------------
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TEST" assignee="-1" summary="Issue summary 111" reporter="sandeep" issueKeyVar="issuekey1"/>
<jira:AttachFile key="${issuekey1}" filepath="C:\\images\Library.jpg" option="override"/>
</JiraJelly>

I hope I didn't misunderstand the jelly documentation, but the 'key' attribute for the AttachFile jelly tag, can it reference an Issue that is dynamically created? I tried, but the above script failed. I was only able to attach a file to the issue if I knew ahead of time the exact issue I want to attach the file to, as so:

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
<jira:AttachFile key="TEST-130" filepath="C:\images\Library.jpg" option="override"/>
</JiraJelly>

This sounds like a bug or user error?

Thank you.

/Sandeep
fields.summary: can't create an attachment to a dynamically created issue in a jelly script

fields.description:
One of our support came up with a "jira would be even better if" suggestion for flagging attachments as obsolete and/or versioning of attachments (similar to confluence).

The problem comes from wishing to attach updated files to a ticket which replace/obsolete existing files, but without loosing those original files either.

The current process seems to be:

1 - Attach somefile.doc
2 - Attach somefile2.doc
3 - Attach somefile3.doc

This leads to having a support person having to hunt for the "current" version of the attachment when working on the ticket.

It would be great if Jira supported versioned attachments in a fashion similar to confluence, whereby if you upload an attachment with a duplicate file name, the file replaces the original attachment and only the most recent copy is (initially) displayed for access.
fields.summary: Provide versioning of attachments similar to Confluence

fields.description:
users created in context with role association:
jira-developer - developer1
jira-user - sjangity

Developer/Issue Reporter does meet the 'Resolve Issue' condition that is required to put bugs into 'Reopen Issue' transition. I am using the default 'jira' workflow for this project.

<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
	<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TEST" assignee="developer1" summary="Issue summary 111" reporter="sjangity" issueKeyVar="issuekey1" duplicateSummary="ignore"/>
	<jira:TransitionWorkflow key="${issuekey1}" user="sjangity" workflowAction="Reopen Issue"/>
</JiraJelly>

When I execute this exception:
org.apache.commons.jelly.JellyTagException: null:3:0: Found workflow transition with name/id 'Reopen Issue' but that is not a valid workflow transition for the current state of issue 'TEST-1'.java.io.PrintWriter@17bc514

I am migrating lots of bugs, and I would hate to have to first "CLOSE" the bug and "Reopen" a bug. Why can't I transition directly to the reopened state as this tool (JellyRunner) is used for migration purposes if I am not mistaken.

Very important for us to have fixed.
fields.summary: can't transition a bug into any other state other than resolve/close after creating issue with jelly script

fields.description:
When profiling is enabled and the Renderer component is successfully wrapped with the dynamic proxy (see JRA-13625), the initializeComponents() method of WikiRendererFactory throws a ClassCastException as it attempts to cast the Renderer component to a V2Renderer class. This cast succeeds when profiling is disabled because the Renderer component is actually an instance of V2Renderer, but with the dynamic proxy in place, the component is only seen as a Renderer object. This cast is necessary as the method uses the setComponents() method which is defined in V2Renderer but not the Renderer interface.

The suggested solution is to promote the setComponents() method to the Renderer interface.

Please note that this issue is also causing newly-written Selenium tests which test the Wiki Rendering functionality to break, because by default Selenium tests enable profiling.
fields.summary: Renderer component does not work with profiling enabled

fields.description:
When you enable Profiling through the Administration interface in JIRA, it doesn't automatically reload the components already registered with the ComponentManager. Because it does not do this, the components are not wrapped by the Profiling dynamic proxy (TimerInvocationHandler), and thus all the implicit profiling that is supposed to occur (timing method invocations and so on) doesn't. Note that explicit profiling works as expected.

One way to get the implicit profiling to work after enabling profiling is to restore an XML backup of your instance's data. This operation reloads the ComponentManager and thus correctly wraps the components with the dynamic proxy.
fields.summary: Implicit profiling functionality broken

fields.description:
Hello,

Due to possible spam on a public server it would be nice to be able to have people notified of new users creation:
- On signup
- Autocreation with an incoming mail handler.

It can warn the admins that some maintenance tasks are needed: User could be duplicated is he changed his email adress, a spammer might need to be removed, etc).
fields.summary: Notification of user signup and auto creation by mail

fields.description:
I was encouraged after submitting a support case to report the following problem;

Why are the "Time remaining" estimates for the "Version workload" and "Time tracking" reports different?
.... the Version workload report says: 4 weeks, 2 days, 3 hours and the Time tracking report says: 6 weeks, 2 hours, 30 minutes for the remaining time ...

Emily Stumpf [Atlassian]: ... I loaded your data and was able to reproduce the problem

Emily Stumpf [Atlassian]: ... When I spoke to the developers they seemed to know that it existed, but since they didn't say it was only unresolved issues in the description, they didn't say that it was actually a bug, but that yes, it is at the very least confusing. I would recommend filing a bug report at jira.atlassian.com. I looked through a bit and did not see it listed previously (although it is possible that I missed it). 


Please see the following support case for screenshot;
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-15841
fields.summary: Remaining time is not identical on Version Workload and Time tracking report
Can not sign up after changing login mode from "private" to "public"

fields.description:
Prior to discovering this problem I had created a new issue type, then created a custom field (select list with 10 items, default set) to that issue type and a specific project.

After updating my XML-RPC based code to use the new issue type, I see the issue created in the correct project, but the custom field has a value of "None" rather than the default value I expected.
fields.summary: Custom field defaults are not applied when issue created via XML-RPC

fields.description: See PERF-130
fields.summary: Upgrade perforce used for testing the JIRA Perforce Plugin

fields.description:
Currently the log4j settings being shipped in the builds  have the filelog pointing to wherever the startup script is called from.

I would suggest changing 
log4j.appender.filelog.File=atlassian-jira.log

to

log4j.appender.filelog.File=${catalina.home}/logs/atlassian-jira.log

so that future releases drop the logs into the logs/atlassian-jira.log
fields.summary: log4j logging to incorrect location on unix systems.

fields.description:
Implementing cropping in Screenshot java plugin.

This will save time for QA/DEV teams attaching images to tasks.

This is a nice-to-have feature
fields.summary: Implementing cropping in Screenshot java plugin

fields.description: To be consistent with the Issue Navigator, the summary field should probably be linked to the issue
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report's summary field should be linked

fields.description:
On the Time Tracking Report, maybe the UI should collapse the Value & Total into a single cell when there are no subtasks? It seems pretty noisy if you're not using subtasks  to see two exactly the same values, and if you don't really _think_ about the subtask issue, you'd have NFI why the funny greek symbol is there.

Specifically:
* For issue with no subtask, have the single estimate colspan 2 and aligned with the sum field (no middle border)
* For issues with subtask, have the current UI

This way, to quickly scan the estimate, the important column is still there (and flushed right) and the value used for the calculation is still available to the left
fields.summary: Issues without Sub-Tasks shouldn't display the Time Tracking info twice

fields.description:
Bug or documentation? It looks as though if you choose the "Incomplete Issues Only" it also adds the condition that there must be work logged against it

eg. This first link shows many Open issues

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?subtaskInclusion=all&sortingOrder=most&versionId=12213&completedFilter=all&selectedProjectId=11011&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.reports%3Atime-tracking&Next=Next

VS

The 2nd has only Open *and* Estimated issues
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?subtaskInclusion=all&sortingOrder=most&versionId=12213&completedFilter=incomplete&selectedProjectId=11011&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.reports%3Atime-tracking&Next=Next
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report's "Incomplete Issues Only" also hides issues with no estimates

fields.description:
The global time-tracking field is used for our development team;  We'd like to add another field for QA.  I checked the "Custom fields" section and didn't see a way to add this as a custom field.  Is this possible in version 3.10.2?  If not, can this be added in a future version?

Thanks,
Doris
fields.summary: Additional Custom Time-tracking Field

fields.description:
Space is legal symbol in filename.
Why do we replace it to '+'?
fields.summary: When downloading attachment with spaces in file name, JIRA replaces spaces to "+"

fields.description:
Hi,

issue JRA-2737 was misunderstood and has not been resolved. What Nick Minutello wanted was a dropdown or picker with the users from ONE group or project role. Maybe more than one group but definitely (a) not all users and (b) not from all groups.

Our actual problem is the migration of solutions to our servers. Not all people have the rights to migrate solutions to the next test stage or even the production system. So it would be nice to be able to assign issues to the corresponding "migrator" for the specific server. Having manually editable lists here is not a really good solution. Assigning to a group is no solution either because no mail is issued.

Jens
fields.summary: "Single User from Group Picker" desperately needed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13604].
  {panel}

Similar to POST functions that are set AFTER a transition is executed (after pressing e.g. the 'Resolve issue' BUTTON), it would be very useful to also be able to set PRE functions (values set in the transition view after the Available Workflow Action LINK is pressed = BEFORE the button is pressed).
Thus, it is possible to set default values in the transition screen, but the user can still change it.

E.g.:
- press Available Workflow Action link 'Resolve issue'
(invisibly, the assignee is set to the Reporter by the PRE function)
- enter the screen which is set in the Transition View of the 'Resolve issue' transaction
- here, the assignee is set to the default value Reporter;  but the user can still change it
- press the Resolve issue button to confirm
fields.summary: Ability to initialise field values for a transition screen

fields.description: {{issuetypes-search.js}} should be converted in to a web resource rather than a statically referenced javascript file.  At the moment this is one of the few js files that doesn't have an expiry date.
fields.summary: issuetypes-search.js should be converted to a web-resource

fields.description: The EmoticonRendererComponent in JIRA currently uses the DefaultIconManager from atlassian-renderer.  It should be using the JiraIconManager.  The outcome of this is that wiki fields do not show the UserProfile icon nor the down arrow next to attachment links.
fields.summary: The EmoticonRendererComponent uses the incorrect IconManager

fields.description:
As loading the listeners is not synchronised, when JIRA is starting up and an event is generated, the following error could occur:

2007-07-11 18:24:56,127 http-8020-Processor22 ERROR [layoutmanager.web.action.CreateIssueDetails] java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:787)
at java.util.HashMap$ValueIterator.next(HashMap.java:817)
at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(IssueEventDispatcher.java:99)
at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(IssueEventDispatcher.java:88)
at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction.execute(FireIssueEventFunction.java:60)
at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.executeFunction(AbstractWorkflow.java:869)
at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1265)
at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:618)
at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.SimpleWorkflowManager.createIssue(SimpleWorkflowManager.java:189)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:365)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:313)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
fields.summary: Loading Event Listeners is not synchronized

fields.description: It would be cool to have the ability to build SQL queries on the fly and save them as a filter.  What I was really looking to do was in the "Find Issues" screen search for all issues not updated since a relative date.
fields.summary: SQL Builder or Search for Tickets Not Updated since {relative_date}

fields.description:
At the moment we do not display whether a Version is released or unreleased and what its released date is on the VIew Issue page. Doing this would help customers understand if a fixed issue is shipped or not.

See comments on JRA-13096 for the motivation on this issue.
fields.summary: Display more information about the versions of an issue on the View Issue page

fields.description:
Setting to mail transport to SMTPS as described in [our docs|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/smtpconfig.html] in order to get an SMTPS connection does not work and has not worked for a long time. Fortunately the alternative of simply setting an {{SSLSocketFactory}} appears to work for some.

We need to either [fix the bug|MAIL-19] in {{atlassian-mail}} or fix the docs.
fields.summary: Setting transport to SMTPS in JNDI mail resource is broken

fields.description: If an email throws a {{javax.mail.internet.ParseException}} while trying to read an email, it should forward it.  Atm, it simply throws an error every time the service runs!
fields.summary: Email should be forwarded if we can't parse it

fields.description:
At the moment, if an error is thrown during the running of the MailFetcherService, there is no way to determine which service it is.
If it is throwing an error while reading an email, it is impossible to find out which mail box it is referring to.
fields.summary: Add Mail Server Name and Id to all logging from MailFetcherService

fields.description:
Suggested feature:

Instead of just applying notifications to workflow steps/transitions, and then grouping the notifications into a scheme applied to projects - can you also add a "caveat" to the scheme whereby JIRA only executes the notifications in the scheme on issues of a particular priority, or issues of X priority and/or higher/lower?

So you still create the scheme as current, and then you also select to apply it to say "all" issues by default, or apply it to issues of X priorities in whatever project uses the scheme.

This would allow project teams to reduce email traffic (seems to be popular) by directing notifications to specific project roles ... ie "minor" issues can be directed to a Project Coordinator, while "major" issues can also be directed to a Project Manager.
fields.summary: Suggested feature - Apply notification schemes by issue priority.

fields.description:
User Picker shows all matching users, including people who are not members of project teams through groups or project roles.
JIRA does not provide functionality to disable user accounts (JRA-2220), so the only way to "disable" them is to remove from groups/project roles.
Unfortunately they can be seen in User Picker and can be selected by mistake.
fields.summary: Do not show in User Picker users who are not members of groups/Project Roles ("disabled")

fields.description: I cannot change case of filter name - wanted to make filter name title cased, but got error message, see screenshot.
fields.summary: Filter name must be case sensitive
Enforce ASCII-compatible attachment filenames

fields.description:
I do not have much detail.
It has been reported by one of our customer.
fields.summary: Attaching a file does not work in Safari

fields.description: "Pick a date" / "Pick a date and time" / "Pick a date range" string is hard-coded in several places. It should be replaced with internationalized strings.
fields.summary: Replace hard-coded string in date pickers

fields.description:
I've received the same question a few times:
"Can I downgrade from Enterprise to Standard in one go, or do I have to go through Professional first?"

and was wondering if we can address this on the page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/RvEC

Also, I think we should rename that page to: Downgrading JIRA
fields.summary: Downgrading from Enterprise to Standard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13579].
  {panel}

(Added by Ian Daniel on behalf of Myron.)

It would be useful to restrict the ability to run reports to certain users, probably by restricting reports to members of specified groups.

For some JIRA instances that have external access to customers, you don't want to customers to be able to run reports.

I have had this request once before (or at least a question as to whether we support restricting access to reports).
fields.summary: Restrict access to reports to some users/groups

fields.description: The section title for *Dates and Times* in Issue Navigator has a typo in Slovak language. It says _Dátumy a časys_, where it shoud be *Dátumy a časy* (no 's' at the end)
fields.summary: Typo in Issue Navigator in Slovak language

fields.description:
We made a change to JIRA 3.10.1 preventing adding Anyone to the jira-users global permission: JRA-13049. Unfortunately we now have a small bug:

1. In a JIRA 3.10 instance, add Anyone to jira-users.

2. Upgrade the instance to 3.10.1 (or 3.10.2). 

3. Try to remove Anyone from jira-users in the 3.10.1 instance. JIRA won't let you, saying that "The group 'Anyone' is not allowed to be added to the permission 'JIRA Users'. See the [attached screenshot|^anyone.png].
fields.summary: Can't remove Anyone from jira-users global permission in JIRA 3.10.1 upgraded from earlier version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13575].
  {panel}

We recently had a severe issue where our mail service was giving us lots of warnings in the log file and it was intermittently creating JIRA tasks. Sometime it would create a task and sometimes it wouldn't, and the log files didn't give us enough info to point us in the right direction. The problem was a typo in the "handler parameters." We had "reportusername" instead of "reporterusername" and we had lots of difficulty discovering this.

This enhancement request is, first, to make all handler parameters into either select lists, radio buttons, or text boxes, etc. This way the parameter name and syntax doesn't have to be "known" by the user and doesn't have to be looked up in the documentation. Currently, the "Handler," "Uses SSL," and "Server" parameters are select lists, so please continue that format for all other parameters. Thus, it will be much more user friendly and less error prone.

By the way, the "Uses SSL" could be a radio button, since there are only two options. How about "SSL: Yes    No".

Next, check each parameter value with JavaScript (or the like), so that invalid values aren't stored. In other words, the "delay" is already checked to make sure that it's numeric. Other values should be the same. It could be that if all other values are controlled, then there won't be any checking necessary.

The implementation of this will almost make a service bullet and fool proof. Thanks!
fields.summary: Edit Mail Service Needs

fields.description:
With the Wiki renderer enabled, after pasting HTML into a comment , all other comments below this one don't appear, wether they are text or HTML.
By changing the comments sort order, I can make the other comments appear again because they are displayed before the HTML one.
fields.summary: Comment with HTML content prevents other comments to appear

fields.description: Please see screenshot
fields.summary: in the 'Add Priority' form, should 'Status Color' be 'Priority Colour' ?

fields.description:
The FishEye extension to Jira can currently only be configured to log into FishEye with a fixed user-login & password.

Since different users might have different access rights in FishEye, the Jira extension should be changed so it can be configured to forward the Jira user credentials to the FishEye plugin, so the Jira user credentials is also used against the FishEye remote API.

I am unsure whether this is possible at all (storage of user credentials?) in a setup where LDAP is used.

(We're using LDAP for both Jira and FishEye user authentication.)
fields.summary: Jira user credentials should be forwarded to FishEye plugin

fields.description:
In order to avoid brute force attacks on closed Jira installations where public sign-up is not possible, it should be possible to put a 'CAPTCHA' on the user login page, so all user logins require human interaction.

As things are now, it is only possible to enable 'CAPTCHA' on the user creation page.

It should be possible to enable/disable this feature through the administration modules.
fields.summary: CAPTCHA should be possible to enable on user login page
Create a new gadget "Quick Issue and log work"

fields.description:
The jelly tag documentation does not provide sufficient information about create issue with custom field value.

* http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/jelly.html#Create+Issue+with+Custom+Field+values

For example, adding value for Version Picker custom field or Single Version Picker, it need to use version id value instead of version value 
{noformat}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TST" ...>

<jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Version Picker" value="10001"/>
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Version Picker" value="10002"/>
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Single Version Picker" value="10003"/>

</jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{noformat}

Another example,  the multi user picker custom field need to use the comma symbol (,) to separate the values which you want to add into a single customfield

{noformat}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TST" ...>
<core:set var="users" value="${user1 + ',' + user2}"/>
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Multi user" value="${users}"/>
</jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Improvement on Jelly tag documentation

fields.description:
I was trying to do the CSV import with the version name that contained dot ( . ) in Version Picker customfield. However, I got the following error message during CSV import:

{code}
[10:54:06] FAILED: Customfield value Version 1.2_b6 is invalid
[10:54:06] com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: Version Id is not a number 'Version 1.2_b6'
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.VersionCFType.getLongFromString(VersionCFType.java:427)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.VersionCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(VersionCFType.java:261)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:548)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.ImporterThread.run(ImporterThread.java:21)
{code}
fields.summary: CSV import failed when the customfield has the version name that contained dot ( . )
